text: I strongly disagree. Capital punishment is a barbaric practice that perpetuates a cycle of violence and vengeance. It doesn't bring back the lost loved ones or heal the pain of the victims' families. Instead, it creates more suffering and doesn't address the root causes of crime. Every person, no matter their actions, has inherent dignity and should have the opportunity for rehabilitation and redemption. By abolishing capital punishment, we can move towards a more humane and just society.

This is not about the competency of its members, but about the distribution of power in our judiciary. The Supreme Court's authority shouldn't be perceived as a given simply due to its historical significance. The concentration of such power in a single entity is a concern that merits discussion.
